title: Joe Hart's Manchester City career looks over as Pep Guardiola talks up Willy Cabellero and even Claudio Bravo
text:
Sport Joe Hart's Manchester City career looks over as Pep Guardiola talks up Willy Cabellero and even Claudio Bravo England No1 faces finding another club when Torino loan ends after boss stresses he's "so happy" with current keepers Share Hart may play in England next season, but it seems highly unlikely to be for Guardiola (inset) (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Pep Guardiola has signalled the end of Joe Hart’s Manchester City career. 
Blues boss Guardiola has dismissed keeper Hart ’s chances of playing for him again when his season-long loan spell with Torino ends, claiming he is content with Claudio Bravo and Willy Caballero. 
When asked directly if England No 1 Hart has a future at City, Guardiola replied: “I’m so happy with Willy and Claudio.” 
Hart is faced with finding a new club in the summer. 
Guardiola added: “We are going to talk about it at the end of the season.” Hart played one Champions League qualifier for Guardiola in pre-season... (Photo: PA Wire) ...but he was soon shipped out to Italy's Torino for the rest of the season (Photo: Getty) 
The Spaniard has decided to offload Hart because he trusts the Englishman's former understudy Caballero, and says he is likely to continue with him and Bravo next season. 
The City boss hinted he may offer Caballero, who is out of contract in the summer, a new deal. 
Guardiola says he will decide the future of all of his out-of-contract players, including midfielder Yaya Toure (who turns 34 in May), 31-year-old Aleksandar Kolarov and Pablo Zabaleta, 32, at the end of the season. Caballero was Hart's back-up last season but has emerged as first-choice... (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) ...as £15m summer-buy Bravo has struggled to adjust to the Premier League (Photo: PA) 
“We’ll think about that, but we’ll make the decision at the end of the season,” he said. “They have to try to keep going, to convince me every day. 
“There are five, six players out of contract, but they know the situation. 
"Of course there is a risk, maybe they can sign a contract for another club and we have to accept that. But we are going to decide in the last months of the season.” poll loading Has Joe Hart played his last game for Manchester City? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
